Package ws.rocket.path.meta.http

Semantic contracts for tree node values capable of handling HTTP requests.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Deletable
    Contract for objects capable of handling HTTP DELETE requests.
    Editable
    Shortcut contract for objects capable of handling both HTTP GET and POST requests.
    Submitable
    Contract for objects capable of handling HTTP POST requests.
    Uploadable
    Contract for objects capable of handling HTTP PUT requests.
    Viewable
    Contract for objects capable of handling HTTP GET requests.

Package ws.rocket.path.meta.http Description

Semantic contracts for tree node values capable of handling HTTP requests. There is exactly one contract for each HTTP methods except HEAD, OPTONS and TRACE, which are usually optional and not handled by tree nodes. Another kind of exception is Editable contract, which is a short-hand for Viewable + Submitable, indicating a resource (URI) that has a view (viewable) where data can be edited (submitable).

All contracts declare a very similar method with corresponding HTTP method name: 

 View doXxx(HttpServletRequest request);

Instead of composing the response directly, each implementation returns a View object, which handles the rendering of response. To better facilitate all possible views that the application may return, a view factory should be created that the node values may use.

See Also:
View
